definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing

sentences.english: He sought profitable words, and wrote words most right, and full of truth.
sentences.chinese: 训道者费神寻找适当的语句，忠诚地写下了真理之言。

sentences.english: In either case, one need not bother to calculate both sets of coefficients .
sentences.chinese: 在这两种情况中，都不必费神去计算两组系数。

sentences.english: Knitting is a very tedious work.
sentences.chinese: 编织毛线衣，是很费神耗时的工作。

sentences.english: Don't stop to collect the materials; I have prepared them for you.
sentences.chinese: 别费神收集材料了，我已给你准备好了。

sentences.english: So why should I bother to seek out the church's fellowship?
sentences.chinese: 既然如此，我们为甚么仍要费神与教会会友交往呢？

sentences.english: Many people are having the hard time of finding the right gift for the person whom they are giving it to.
sentences.chinese: 很多的人在挑选合适的礼物这件事情上很费神。
这里不需要为数据费神。

sentences.english: It was so exhausting, and I was so miserable.
sentences.chinese: 这一切让我太费神了，也很痛苦。

sentences.english: Pretty soon, you do not bother to send her to school every morning.
sentences.chinese: 用不了多久，您就不必费神每天早晨送她上学了。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to expend a great deal of effort
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
taxing (mentally or emotionally)
to spend a great deal of time and effort/(of a task) demanding/exacting
to worry about
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to argue needlessly/to waste time explaining
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
to require effort/strenuous
to worry/to be on one's mind
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
there is no need/why should
